page.title: 01INTRODUCTION TO GEDDINGTON
page.content: Geddington is an active village of about 1,300 people, 4 miles northeast of Kettering on the A43. It has 7 shops, a recreation field, 3 pubs, 39 clubs and a Primary School. It has some industrial premises and several farms. There is a Village Hall which overlooks tennis courts and the recreation field, bordering the river. In Queen Street there is a Chapel built in 1875. A Medieval bridge spans the River Ise. In the centre of the village stands Queen Eleanor's Cross, built in 1294 by Edward I to mark the resting place of the body of his wife on the journey from Harby to London. West of the school is the Church of Mary Magdalene. Most of the houses around the centre of the village are made of limestone.
